intro: Camelina rumelica subsp. rumelica, commonly known as the Balkan camelina, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important oilseed crops. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are often used for oil extraction. This subspecies is valued for its adaptability to harsh environments and its potential in sustainable agriculture.
